channel.title: My geek blog
channel.description: Recent content on My geek blog

item.title: Configuring ORG-ROAM
item.description: Hi! it has been a while! Sorry about that, you was expeting me?

item.title: Securizing Org files with Org-crypt
item.description: Inspiration This comes from the need that I am using python in org-babel to integrate my PM workflow between org-mode and JIRA.

item.title: Visualizing data with Javascript
item.description: Recently I found D3js project, I really found it interesting and I made a short project to try to implement data visualization using this library.

item.title: Getting lost and found
item.description: It’s really frustrating to be following your own footsteps every time, as you may notice I love exploring, trying new things, tools, commands, etc… I would say that I’m not the only one that “learned” something new on the terminal after looking for some solutions online and reading some fucking manuals and once configured properly then you forget it almost instantly.

item.title: Learning and adopting Hugo on this blog
item.description: This is my very first post exported from Hugo… Let’s learn!

item.title: Revisiting your own (old) code
item.description: Almost two weeks ago I received a call for a good friend of mine, and also owner of an Hardware Store, those kind of familiar SMEs that are commited to survive through the years thanks for the every effort and their commitment to the service more over than the product.

item.title: Minimizing the blog concept
item.description: This is one of the main principles of this blog: to avoid bloated meta-information just to support content.

item.title: About
item.description: This blog is written in Emacs using Org and exported with ox-hugo to an static generated Hugo web site.

item.title: Documenting my personalization on linux
item.description: I will share with you the approach of one project that I’m working on several months ago.

item.title: How to deobfuscate CSS
item.description: I found a very quite simple process to deobfuscate CSS files This is simple, if the CSS is not linked to any page, just link it in the HTML and open the .
